did.unittitle:
Leo A. Burns photograph collection
ca. 1890-ca. 1915?
did.abstract: Battle Creek, Michigan, resident; glass negatives of houses and house interiors, of children, women, boating scenes, and a railroad car, possibly taken in the Battle Creek, Michigan area.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Susan Wineberg (donor no. 5400).

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the records are not expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Leo A. Burns photograph collection, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Leo A. Burns, following his service in World War I, graduated in 1921 the University of Michigan. He lived in Battle Creek, Michigan and worked in the insurance business.

scopecontent.p: The collection is arranged into a single series of glass negative with two subseries for different sizes (4"x5" and5"x8"). The negatives are unidentified, but they are probably of a Battle Creek area family or families, perhaps the family of Burns's wife, Betty Hoyt.
